request.description: Clears chat messages between the authenticated user and a specified receiver by marking messages as deleted from each side.
Marks a specific chat message as seen by updating its `seen` status.
Removes a specific chat message for the authenticated user. The message can be removed for "everyone" or marked as deleted for the sender only.
Sends a notification to the receiver when they receive a new chat message. If `is_delete` is set, it marks the specified notification as deleted.

request.description:
This endpoint allows the authenticated user to send an email to specified recipients,
with the option to include CC recipients and attachments. Notifications are sent to recipients as well.

formdata.description: JSON-encoded array of recipient emails in the format [{"value": "user1@example.com"}, {"value": "user2@example.com"}].
JSON-encoded array of CC recipient emails in the same format as the "to" field. Optional.
The subject of the reply email.
The body content of the reply email.
The ID of the main email thread being replied to.

request.description:
This endpoint allows the authenticated user to reply to an existing email thread,
including attachments and notifications to recipients.

formdata.description: JSON-encoded array of recipient emails in the format [{"value": "user1@example.com"}, {"value": "user2@example.com"}].
JSON-encoded array of CC recipient emails in the same format as the "to" field. Optional.
The subject of the forwarded email.
The body content of the forwarded email.

request.description:
This endpoint allows the authenticated user to forward an existing email to a list of recipients,
including optional CC recipients and attachments.

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to delete multiple emails by marking them as deleted.
The emails are logically deleted by setting the `is_delete` flag and `deleted_at` timestamp.

This endpoint allows the authenticated user to delete multiple sent emails by marking them as deleted.
The emails are logically deleted by setting the `is_delete` flag and `deleted_at` timestamp.

request.description: Allows the deletion of a group and its associated data, such as members and chat history, only if the authenticated user is an admin.
Allows an existing admin to make another member an admin.
Marks the specified chat message as seen by the authenticated user.
Deletes a chat message from the group. If `del_from` is set to `everyone`, the message is deleted for all members; otherwise, it is deleted only for the authenticated user.
Clears all chat messages for a specified group. Only admins are permitted to perform this action.

Manages notifications for group chat messages. If the user has a new message, it sends a notification;
otherwise, it marks the notification as read.
